What is the purpose of the `-arbitragecurrencies` option in Verus?
The `-arbitragecurrencies` option allows you to specify a JSON array or a comma-separated list of currency names that can be used for arbitrage.

`-arbitragecurrencies`   Either a JSON array or a comma separated list of currency names.`-arbitrageaddress`   A valid wallet address or identity controlled by this wallet that will   hold the arbitrage currencies to use.`-cheatcatcher=<sapling-address>`    same as "-defaultzaddr"`-defaultid=<i-address>`    VerusID used for default change out and staking reward recipient`-defaultzaddr=<sapling-address>`    sapling address to receive fraud proof rewards and if used with    "-privatechange=1", z-change address for the sendcurrency command`-disablewallet`    Do not load the wallet and disable wallet RPC calls`-keypool=<n>`    Set key pool size to <n> (default: 100)`-maxtxfee=<amt>`    Maximum total fees (in VRSC) to use in a single wallet transaction;    setting this too low may abort large transactions (default: 0.10)`-migration`    Enable the Sprout to Sapling migration`-migrationdestaddress=<zaddr>`    Set the Sapling migration address`-paytxfee=<amt>`    Fee (in VRSC/kB) to add to transactions you send (default: 0.0001)`-privatechange`    directs all change from sendcurency or z_sendmany APIs to the    defaultzaddr set, if it is a valid sapling address`-rescan`    Rescan the block chain for missing wallet transactions on startup`-salvagewallet`    Attempt to recover private keys from a corrupt wallet.dat on startup`-sendfreetransactions`    Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)`-spendzeroconfchange`    Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions (default: 1)`-storagefeefactor`    Defaults to 6.0, which is used for 6K outputs to price storage in a currency's TransactionExportFee (ie. 6.0 = 1 TransactionExportFee per K).`-txconfirmtarget=<n>`    If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so transactions begin    confirmation on average within n blocks (default: 2)`-txexpirydelta`    Set the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been    mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40    (post-Blossom))`-upgradewallet`    Upgrade wallet to latest format on startup`-wallet=<file>`    Specify wallet file (within data directory) (default: wallet.dat)`-walletbroadcast`    Make the wallet broadcast transactions (default: 1)`-walletnotify=<cmd>`    Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced    by TxID)
./raw_txt_input/clifaq-01_verusd_options.md
What is the purpose of the `-sendfreetransactions` option in Verus?
The `-sendfreetransactions` option sends transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0).

`-arbitragecurrencies`   Either a JSON array or a comma separated list of currency names.`-arbitrageaddress`   A valid wallet address or identity controlled by this wallet that will   hold the arbitrage currencies to use.`-cheatcatcher=<sapling-address>`    same as "-defaultzaddr"`-defaultid=<i-address>`    VerusID used for default change out and staking reward recipient`-defaultzaddr=<sapling-address>`    sapling address to receive fraud proof rewards and if used with    "-privatechange=1", z-change address for the sendcurrency command`-disablewallet`    Do not load the wallet and disable wallet RPC calls`-keypool=<n>`    Set key pool size to <n> (default: 100)`-maxtxfee=<amt>`    Maximum total fees (in VRSC) to use in a single wallet transaction;    setting this too low may abort large transactions (default: 0.10)`-migration`    Enable the Sprout to Sapling migration`-migrationdestaddress=<zaddr>`    Set the Sapling migration address`-paytxfee=<amt>`    Fee (in VRSC/kB) to add to transactions you send (default: 0.0001)`-privatechange`    directs all change from sendcurency or z_sendmany APIs to the    defaultzaddr set, if it is a valid sapling address`-rescan`    Rescan the block chain for missing wallet transactions on startup`-salvagewallet`    Attempt to recover private keys from a corrupt wallet.dat on startup`-sendfreetransactions`    Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)`-spendzeroconfchange`    Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions (default: 1)`-storagefeefactor`    Defaults to 6.0, which is used for 6K outputs to price storage in a currency's TransactionExportFee (ie. 6.0 = 1 TransactionExportFee per K).`-txconfirmtarget=<n>`    If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so transactions begin    confirmation on average within n blocks (default: 2)`-txexpirydelta`    Set the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been    mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40    (post-Blossom))`-upgradewallet`    Upgrade wallet to latest format on startup`-wallet=<file>`    Specify wallet file (within data directory) (default: wallet.dat)`-walletbroadcast`    Make the wallet broadcast transactions (default: 1)`-walletnotify=<cmd>`    Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced    by TxID)

What does the `-salvagewallet` option do in Verus?
The `-salvagewallet` option attempts to recover private keys from a corrupt wallet.dat on startup.

What is the purpose of the `-wallet` option in Verus?
The `-wallet` option specifies the wallet file (within the data directory) (default: wallet.dat).

What is the purpose of the `-maxtxfee` option in Verus?
The `-maxtxfee` option sets the maximum total fees (in VRSC) to use in a single wallet transaction. Setting this too low may abort large transactions (default: 0.10).

The `-migrationdestaddress` option sets the Sapling migration address.

   setting this too low may abort large transactions (default: 0.10)`-migration`    Enable the Sprout to Sapling migration`-migrationdestaddress=<zaddr>`    Set the Sapling migration address`-paytxfee=<amt>`    Fee (in VRSC/kB) to add to transactions you send (default: 0.0001)`-privatechange`    directs all change from sendcurency or z_sendmany APIs to the    defaultzaddr set, if it is a valid sapling address`-rescan`    Rescan the block chain for missing wallet transactions on startup`-salvagewallet`    Attempt to recover private keys from a corrupt wallet.dat on startup`-sendfreetransactions`    Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)`-spendzeroconfchange`    Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions (default: 1)`-storagefeefactor`    Defaults to 6.0, which is used for 6K outputs to price storage in a currency's TransactionExportFee (ie. 6.0 = 1 TransactionExportFee per K).`-txconfirmtarget=<n>`    If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so transactions begin    confirmation on average within n blocks (default: 2)`-txexpirydelta`    Set the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been    mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40    (post-Blossom))`-upgradewallet`    Upgrade wallet to latest format on startup`-wallet=<file>`    Specify wallet file (within data directory) (default: wallet.dat)`-walletbroadcast`    Make the wallet broadcast transactions (default: 1)`-walletnotify=<cmd>`    Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced    by TxID)
./raw_txt_input/clifaq-01_verusd_options.md
What is the purpose of the `-txexpirydelta` option in Verus?
The `-txexpirydelta` option sets the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40 (post-Blossom)).

What does the `-disablewallet` option do in Verus?
The `-disablewallet` option disables the loading of the wallet and disables wallet RPC calls.

What is the purpose of the `-txconfirmtarget` option in Verus?
The `-txconfirmtarget` option sets the number of blocks that a transaction is expected to be confirmed within, if `paytxfee` is not set.

What is the purpose of the `-defaultzaddr` option in Verus?
The `-defaultzaddr` option specifies a sapling address to receive fraud proof rewards and, if used with `-privatechange=1`, z-change address for the sendcurrency command.

What does the `-privatechange` option do in Verus?
The `-privatechange` option directs all change from sendcurency or z_sendmany APIs to the defaultzaddr set, if it is a valid sapling address.
